dt: {bc}an act by which a person determines the disposition of his or her property after death
{bc}either of two main divisions of the Bible
{bc}a covenant between God and the human race

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Late Latin & Latin; Late Latin {it}testamentum{/it} covenant with God, holy scripture, from Latin, last will, from {it}testari{/it} to be a witness, call to witness, make a will, from {it}testis{/it} witness; akin to Latin {it}tres{/it} three & to Latin {it}stare{/it} to stand; from the witness's standing by as a third party in a litigation {ma}{mat|three|}, {mat|stand|}{/ma}
shortdef: an act by which a person determines the disposition of his or her property after death

dt: {bc}the second part of the Christian Bible comprising the canonical Gospels and Epistles and also the book of Acts and book of Revelation {dx}see {dxt|Bible Table|bible|table}{/dx}

shortdef: the second part of the Christian Bible comprising the canonical Gospels and Epistles and also the book of Acts and book of Revelation

dt: {bc}the first part of the Christian Bible containing the books of the Jewish canon of Scripture {dx}see {dxt|Bible Table|bible|table}{/dx}

shortdef: the first part of the Christian Bible containing the books of the Jewish canon of Scripture

dt: {bc}the second part of the Christian Bible that describes the life of Jesus Christ and the lessons that he taught

shortdef: the second part of the Christian Bible that describes the life of Jesus Christ and the lessons that he taught

dt: {bc}the first part of the Christian Bible that tells about the Jews, their history, and God's words to them in the time before Jesus Christ was born

shortdef: the first part of the Christian Bible that tells about the Jews, their history, and God's words to them in the time before Jesus Christ was born
